Getting Started: HemOnc Example

Source: vignettes/getting-started.Rmd
getting-started.Rmd
library(chariotViz)

ChariotViz visualizes all valid Concepts at the Concept Class level by either properties represented by the CONCEPT_RELATIONSHIP table or by traversing direct relationships via the CONCEPT_ANCESTOR table.

OMOP Relationships are fetched from the CONCEPT_RELATIONSHIP table with corresponding annotations from the CONCEPT table.

omop_relationships <- 
  fetch_omop(version_key = get_version_key())
#> Warning: 'fetch_omop' is deprecated.
#> See help("Deprecated")
#> ℹ Getting total concept class counts
#> ✓ Getting total concept class counts [528ms]
#> 
#> ℹ Getting total vocabulary counts
#> ✓ Getting total vocabulary counts [540ms]
#> 
#> Querying PCORNet Relationships | ■■■■■■■■■■■                      38/117  32% (…
#> Querying BDPM Relationships | ■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■         91/117  78% (5.2…
#> Querying RxNorm Extension Relationships | ■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■  117/…
#> 
#> Calculating UB04 Pt dis status Concept Class Counts | ■■■■■■■■■■               …
#> Calculating MeSH Concept Class Counts | ■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■            78/117…
#> Calculating RxNorm Extension Concept Class Counts | ■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■…
#>

The omop.relationships S4 class object is a dataframe of the query results.

head(omop_relationships@data)
#>   relationship_id                   relationship_name relationship_source
#> 1     Mapped from Standard to Non-standard map (OMOP)                OMOP
#> 2        Subsumes                            Subsumes                <NA>
#> 3        Subsumes                            Subsumes                <NA>
#> 4     Mapped from Standard to Non-standard map (OMOP)                OMOP
#> 5         Type of                             Type of                <NA>
#> 6         Type of                             Type of                <NA>
#>   is_hierarchical defines_ancestry domain_id_1 vocabulary_id_1
#> 1               0                0    Provider        Supplier
#> 2               1                1    Provider        Supplier
#> 3               1                1    Provider        Supplier
#> 4               0                0   Ethnicity       Ethnicity
#> 5               0                0    Metadata        Metadata
#> 6               0                0    Metadata        Metadata
#>   concept_class_id_1 standard_concept_1 concept_count_1
#> 1           Provider                  S               1
#> 2           Provider                  S               1
#> 3           Provider                  S               1
#> 4          Ethnicity                  S               2
#> 5           Metadata               <NA>               1
#> 6           Metadata               <NA>               1
#>   total_concept_class_ct_1 total_vocabulary_ct_1 domain_id_2    vocabulary_id_2
#> 1                        1                     1    Provider Medicare Specialty
#> 2                        1                     1       Visit Medicare Specialty
#> 3                        1                     1       Visit               NUCC
#> 4                        2                     2 Observation            PCORNet
#> 5                        2                     2 Measurement             NAACCR
#> 6                        2                     2 Observation             NAACCR
#>    concept_class_id_2 standard_concept_2 concept_count_2
#> 1 Physician Specialty               <NA>               1
#> 2               Visit                  S              13
#> 3               Visit                  S              14
#> 4            Hispanic               <NA>               2
#> 5     NAACCR Variable                  S             315
#> 6     NAACCR Variable                  S             315
#>   total_concept_class_ct_2 total_vocabulary_ct_2
#> 1                       68                   116
#> 2                       30                   116
#> 3                      179                   845
#> 4                        2                    81
#> 5                     1881                 34060
#> 6                     1881                 34060

This dataframe is then converted to a subset of 2 dataframes of nodes and edges.

omop_nodes_and_edges <- 
  create_nodes_and_edges(omop_relationships = omop_relationships)

head(omop_nodes_and_edges@nodes@data)
#>   id domain_id vocabulary_id    concept_class_id standard_concept
#> 1  1  Provider      Supplier            Provider                S
#> 2  2 Ethnicity     Ethnicity           Ethnicity                S
#> 3  3  Metadata      Metadata            Metadata             <NA>
#> 4  4  Provider      Provider Physician Specialty                S
#> 5  5  Provider      Provider            Provider                S
#> 6  6 Geography     US Census  US Census Division                S
#>   total_concept_class_ct total_vocabulary_ct                type
#> 1                      1                   1            Provider
#> 2                      2                   2           Ethnicity
#> 3                      2                   2            Metadata
#> 4                      1                   4 Physician Specialty
#> 5                      3                   4            Provider
#> 6                      9                  13  US Census Division
#>                                label
#> 1            Supplier\nProvider\n(S)
#> 2          Ethnicity\nEthnicity\n(S)
#> 3           Metadata\nMetadata\n(NA)
#> 4 Provider\nPhysician Specialty\n(S)
#> 5            Provider\nProvider\n(S)
#> 6 US Census\nUS Census Division\n(S)

Prior to visualization, a tooltip and attributes are added.

omop_nodes_and_edges <- 
  omop_nodes_and_edges %>% 
  add_tooltip() %>%
  map_node_attributes() %>% 
  map_edge_attributes()
#> ℹ Shape from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Style from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Color from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Fillcolor from: vocabulary_id
#> ! 41 values not mapped: Supplier, Provider, US Census, Visit, UB04 Point of Origin, MDC, UB04 Pt dis status, CMS Place of Service, ABMS, Medicare Specialty, HES Specialty, CVX, UB04 Typ bill, CGI, VA Class, NUCC, CDM, PPI, OXMIS, Multum, CCAM, OPCS4, CIM10, GGR, VA Product, UK Biobank, KCD7, BDPM, SNOMED Veterinary, OPS, JMDC, CIEL, NCCD, DPD, KDC, AMT, Read, OSM, EDI, dm+d, and SPL. Mapping to `other` value 'gray20'.
#> ℹ Fontcolor from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ 3 constant attributes added: fontsize, width, and height.
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped.
#> ✓ All 17 unique values mapped.
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped.
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ 2 constant attributes added: fontsize and len.

The graph is constructed.

omop_graph <- 
  construct_graph(omop_nodes_and_edges)

The above is a graph of the entire OMOP Vocabularies in its present state.

chariotViz(omop_graph = omop_graph)
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                n nodes   n edges  
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                    650      9030  
#>                              ─────────────────────
#> 
#> Column names: n nodes, n edges
#> There are 650 nodes and 9030 edges.
#> To render anyways, set `force` to TRUE.

Due to the large number of nodes, the graph is not rendered, but can be forced to do so by setting force to TRUE.

Specifically sets of vocabularies can be isolated by filtering the omop.relationships class object prior to conversion to nodes and edges.

Here, we are filtering for relationships within the HemOnc vocabulary only.

hemonc_relationships <- 
  omop_relationships %>% 
  filter_omop_relationships(
    vocabulary_id_1 == "HemOnc",
    vocabulary_id_2 == "HemOnc"
  )

The HemOnc graph is constructed after it is filtered for.

hemonc_graph <- 
  create_nodes_and_edges(hemonc_relationships) %>% 
  add_tooltip() %>% 
  map_node_attributes() %>% 
  map_edge_attributes() %>% 
  construct_graph()
#> ℹ Shape from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Style from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Color from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Fillcolor from: vocabulary_id
#> ✓ All 1 unique value mapped.
#> ℹ Fontcolor from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ 3 constant attributes added: fontsize, width, and height.
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped.
#> ✓ All 5 unique values mapped.
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped.
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ 2 constant attributes added: fontsize and len.

With a smaller node count, chariotViz will automatically render the graph.

chariotViz(hemonc_graph,
           width = 2000,
           height = 2000)
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                n nodes   n edges  
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                     10        52  
#>                              ─────────────────────
#> 
#> Column names: n nodes, n edges

The fillcolor of the nodes can be remapped.

hemonc_graph2 <- 
  hemonc_graph %>% 
  remap_fillcolor_by_concept_class()
#> ✓ All 10 unique values mapped.

chariotViz(hemonc_graph2,
           width = 2000,
           height = 2000)
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                n nodes   n edges  
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                     10        52  
#>                              ─────────────────────
#> 
#> Column names: n nodes, n edges

The relationships can also be filtered based on 3 classes of relationships: Taxonomy, Mapping, or Lateral. These classes are not defined by OHDSI and are specific to the chariot and chariotViz packages.

Taxonomy relationships are relationships that represent a hierarchy (Is a and Subsumes).

hemonc_taxonomy_relationships <- 
  hemonc_relationships %>% 
  filter_for_taxonomy_relationships() 

hemonc_taxonomy_graph <- 
  create_nodes_and_edges(hemonc_taxonomy_relationships) %>% 
  add_tooltip() %>% 
  map_node_attributes() %>% 
  map_edge_attributes() %>% 
  construct_graph() %>% 
  remap_fillcolor_by_concept_class()
#> ℹ Shape from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Style from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Color from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Fillcolor from: vocabulary_id
#> ✓ All 1 unique value mapped.
#> ℹ Fontcolor from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ 3 constant attributes added: fontsize, width, and height.
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped.
#> ✓ All 1 unique value mapped.
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped.
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ 2 constant attributes added: fontsize and len.
#> ✓ All 4 unique values mapped.

chariotViz(hemonc_taxonomy_graph,
           height = 500,
           width = 500)
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                n nodes   n edges  
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                      4         4  
#>                              ─────────────────────
#> 
#> Column names: n nodes, n edges

Mapping relationships are relationships that represent a mapping from a source to target, as in the case of an ETLing into the OMOP CDM. Since we filtered for concepts within HemOnc, the filter returns zero relationships since the basis of these relationships is mapping between different vocabularies.

hemonc_mapping_relationships <- 
  hemonc_relationships %>% 
  filter_for_mapping_relationships() 

hemonc_mapping_relationships
#> An object of class "omop.relationships"
#> Slot "data":
#>  [1] relationship_id          relationship_name        relationship_source     
#>  [4] is_hierarchical          defines_ancestry         domain_id_1             
#>  [7] vocabulary_id_1          concept_class_id_1       standard_concept_1      
#> [10] concept_count_1          total_concept_class_ct_1 total_vocabulary_ct_1   
#> [13] domain_id_2              vocabulary_id_2          concept_class_id_2      
#> [16] standard_concept_2       concept_count_2          total_concept_class_ct_2
#> [19] total_vocabulary_ct_2   
#> <0 rows> (or 0-length row.names)

To view HemOnc’s mapping relationships, we can re-filter the original object for HemOnc on side 1 only.

all_hemonc_relationships <- 
  omop_relationships %>% 
  filter_omop_relationships(
    vocabulary_id_1 == "HemOnc")

hemonc_mapping_relationships <- 
  all_hemonc_relationships %>% 
  filter_for_mapping_relationships() 

hemonc_mapping_relationships
#> An object of class "omop.relationships"
#> Slot "data":
#>   relationship_id                   relationship_name relationship_source
#> 1         Maps to Non-standard to Standard map (OMOP)                OMOP
#> 2         Maps to Non-standard to Standard map (OMOP)                OMOP
#> 3         Maps to Non-standard to Standard map (OMOP)                OMOP
#> 4         Maps to Non-standard to Standard map (OMOP)                OMOP
#> 5         Maps to Non-standard to Standard map (OMOP)                OMOP
#> 6         Maps to Non-standard to Standard map (OMOP)                OMOP
#>   is_hierarchical defines_ancestry domain_id_1 vocabulary_id_1
#> 1               0                0   Condition          HemOnc
#> 2               0                0   Condition          HemOnc
#> 3               0                0        Drug          HemOnc
#> 4               0                0        Drug          HemOnc
#> 5               0                0        Drug          HemOnc
#> 6               0                0        Drug          HemOnc
#>   concept_class_id_1 standard_concept_1 concept_count_1
#> 1          Condition               <NA>               1
#> 2          Condition               <NA>             142
#> 3          Component               <NA>               2
#> 4          Component               <NA>               2

#> 4                      629                  7325        Drug           RxNorm

We can now see how HemOnc maps to other OMOP vocabularies.

hemonc_mapping_graph <- 
  create_nodes_and_edges(hemonc_mapping_relationships) %>% 
  add_tooltip() %>% 
  map_node_attributes() %>% 
  map_edge_attributes() %>% 
  construct_graph() 
#> ℹ Shape from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Style from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Color from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Fillcolor from: vocabulary_id
#> ✓ All 5 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Fontcolor from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ 3 constant attributes added: fontsize, width, and height.
#> ✓ All 1 unique value mapped.
#> ✓ All 1 unique value mapped.
#> ✓ All 1 unique value mapped.
#> ✓ All 1 unique value mapped.
#> ℹ 2 constant attributes added: fontsize and len.

chariotViz(hemonc_mapping_graph,
           height = 500,
           width = 500)
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                n nodes   n edges  
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                      8         6  
#>                              ─────────────────────
#> 
#> Column names: n nodes, n edges

Lateral relationships are relationships that are all other relationships. Returning to the relationships within HemOnc, the lateral relationships are filtered for.

hemonc_lateral_relationships <- 
  hemonc_relationships %>% 
  filter_for_lateral_relationships()

hemonc_lateral_graph <- 
  create_nodes_and_edges(hemonc_lateral_relationships) %>% 
  add_tooltip() %>% 
  map_node_attributes() %>% 
  map_edge_attributes() %>% 
  construct_graph() 
#> ℹ Shape from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Style from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Color from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Fillcolor from: vocabulary_id
#> ✓ All 1 unique value mapped.
#> ℹ Fontcolor from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ 3 constant attributes added: fontsize, width, and height.
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped.
#> ✓ All 4 unique values mapped.
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped.
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ 2 constant attributes added: fontsize and len.

chariotViz(hemonc_lateral_graph,
           height = 2000,
           width = 2000)
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                n nodes   n edges  
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                      9        48  
#>                              ─────────────────────
#> 
#> Column names: n nodes, n edges

With the relationships within and outside of HemOnc, the all_hemonc_relationships returns the following graph.

hemonc_lateral_relationships <- 
  all_hemonc_relationships %>% 
  filter_for_lateral_relationships()

hemonc_lateral_graph <- 
  create_nodes_and_edges(hemonc_lateral_relationships) %>% 
  add_tooltip() %>% 
  map_node_attributes() %>% 
  map_edge_attributes() %>% 
  construct_graph() 
#> ℹ Shape from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Style from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Color from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Fillcolor from: vocabulary_id
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Fontcolor from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ 3 constant attributes added: fontsize, width, and height.
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped.
#> ✓ All 4 unique values mapped.
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped.
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ 2 constant attributes added: fontsize and len.

chariotViz(hemonc_lateral_graph,
           height = 2000,
           width = 2000)

#>                                n nodes   n edges  
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                     14        57  
#>                              ─────────────────────
#> 
#> Column names: n nodes, n edges

To retrieve any relationships outside of HemOnc instead, the original omop_relationships object must be filtered once more, but this time with exclusion of HemOnc in the filter.

foreign_hemonc_relationships <- 
  omop_relationships %>% 
  filter_omop_relationships(
    vocabulary_id_1 == "HemOnc",
    vocabulary_id_2 != "HemOnc") %>% 
  filter_for_lateral_relationships() 

foreign_hemonc_lateral_graph <- 
  create_nodes_and_edges(foreign_hemonc_relationships) %>% 
  add_tooltip() %>% 
  map_node_attributes() %>% 
  map_edge_attributes() %>% 
  construct_graph()
#> ℹ Shape from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Style from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Color from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Fillcolor from: vocabulary_id
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Fontcolor from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ 3 constant attributes added: fontsize, width, and height.
#> ✓ All 1 unique value mapped.
#> ✓ All 1 unique value mapped.
#> ✓ All 1 unique value mapped.
#> ✓ All 1 unique value mapped.
#> ℹ 2 constant attributes added: fontsize and len.

chariotViz(foreign_hemonc_lateral_graph)
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                n nodes   n edges  
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                      6         9  
#>                              ─────────────────────
#> 
#> Column names: n nodes, n edges

Filtering for Taxonomy relationships allows visualization of how ancestry of a vocabulary relates to other vocabularies. Here, it is evident that only HemOnc’s Component Class is a parent to RxNorm and RxNorm Extension Concept Classes.

foreign_hemonc_relationships <- 
  omop_relationships %>% 
  filter_omop_relationships(
    vocabulary_id_1 == "HemOnc",
    vocabulary_id_2 != "HemOnc") %>% 
  filter_for_taxonomy_relationships() 

foreign_hemonc_taxonomy_graph <- 
  create_nodes_and_edges(foreign_hemonc_relationships) %>% 
  add_tooltip() %>% 
  map_node_attributes() %>% 
  map_edge_attributes() %>% 
  construct_graph()
#> ℹ Shape from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Style from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Color from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Fillcolor from: vocabulary_id
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ Fontcolor from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped.
#> ℹ 3 constant attributes added: fontsize, width, and height.
#> ✓ All 1 unique value mapped.
#> ✓ All 1 unique value mapped.
#> ✓ All 1 unique value mapped.
#> ✓ All 1 unique value mapped.
#> ℹ 2 constant attributes added: fontsize and len.

chariotViz(foreign_hemonc_taxonomy_graph)
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                n nodes   n edges  
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                      6         5  
#>                              ─────────────────────
#> 
#> Column names: n nodes, n edges

To view all possible foreign relationships, the filter can be lifted.

foreign_hemonc_relationships <- 
  omop_relationships %>% 
  filter_omop_relationships(
    vocabulary_id_1 == "HemOnc",
    vocabulary_id_2 != "HemOnc") #%>% 
#  filter_for_lateral_relationships() 

foreign_hemonc_graph <- 
  create_nodes_and_edges(foreign_hemonc_relationships) %>% 
  add_tooltip() %>% 
  map_node_attributes() %>% 
  map_edge_attributes() %>% 
  construct_graph()
#> ℹ Shape from: standard_concept
